decision_conditions: The proposed development would by reason of the resulting excessive width, height and depth appear incongruous, dominant and visually intrusive in the front wider street scene detrimental to the character and appearance of the host property and visual amenity of the locality contrary to policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

The proposed development would, by reason of its excessive width, height, bulk and proximity to neighbouring property be an intrusive and overbearing form of development, giving rise to an undue sense of enclosure, particularly in relation to no. 2 Barleycorn Way,  which would have a serious and adverse effect on the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, contrary to policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it is given to Mr Alberto Ochoa via email on 15th October 2020.
